pr_title: CAM-12326: configure nullable field for array and dto properties and enable nullable by default

timeline.message: chore(openapi): enable nullable for string/date/boolean fields
configure nullable field for array and dto properties

timeline.bodyText:
Some typos here:

  
    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            By default the properties of type `boolean`, `string`, 	`array`, and `dto` has `nullable` field enabled by default to ensure ensures work with C# clients.
          
          
            
            By default, the properties of type `boolean`, `string`, `array`, and `dto` have `nullable` field enabled by default to ensure that the OpenAPI specification can work with C# clients.
timeline.author: koevskinikola
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -225,8 +225,9 @@ That will improve the clients that are generated from the OpenAPI documentation.
 
 #### Nullable
 
-Disable `nullable` field to the properties of type `boolean` or `string`, or with `format` field, to specify that they cannot be `null`
-since the default value for those properties is `nullable=true` which ensures working C# clients:
+By default the properties of type `boolean`, `string`, 	`array`, and `dto` has `nullable` field enabled by default to ensure ensures work with C# clients.

timeline.message:
chore(openapi): fix typos in readme

Co-authored-by: Nikola Koevski <nikola.koevski@camunda.com>
